topic.title: Working and Protection Application Support using the DSIS

body.p: This section outlines working and protection application and how it is supported with DSIS. There are 4 supported schemes:

li.p: Support protection switching between OTU4 via DSIS.
Support protection switching between OTUCn via DSIS.
Support bridging (replication) of OTU4 via DSIS.
Support bridging (replication) of OTUCn via DSIS.

body.p: Figure 1 shows the working and protection applications in both the RX and TX direction as described above.

fig.title: Demonstrating the DSIS Working Switch Application

body.p: The first diagram in Figure 1 shows the OTN Egress protection switching. In the TX direction, it can be seen that the bridging is achieved by duplicating the Tx signal from LINEOTN to bank B from the signal going into bank A. In this application, SYSOTN is set up in a special monitor-only mode as the SYSOTN channel just needs to monitor the signal (e.g. PRBS patterns from the SERDES). The SYSOTN channel is only provisioned up to the first Stage framers of COREOTN. Also only the LINEOTN subsystem can broadcast its Tx data. The SYSOTN subsystem is not able to provide the same feature.

The second and third diagrams in Figure 1 shows the OTN Ingress protection switching. In the RX direction, the working and protection switch is demonstrated where the signal would swap over to another bank. The channel from LINEOTN is set up to listen to the SERDES port used for the SYSOTN channel. Then the SYSOTN channel can be set up to listen to the SERDES port used for the LINEOTN channel. In the case of OTUCn group, it is likely that all SERDES ports within the OTUCn group will be remapped to the different set of SERDES ports for another OTUCn group. When this remapping occurs, the relative order of the OTUCs within the appropriate OTUCn group is fixed. That is, the SERDES port of first OTUC in the LINEOTN OTUCn group will be swapped with the SERDES port of the first OTUC in the SYSOTN OTUCn group. The SERDES port of the second OTUC in the LINEOTN OTUCn group will be swapped with the SERDES port of the second OTUC in the SYSOTN OTUCn group, and so on. The device is able to monitor 2xOTUC6 and pick the best one and switch to that path.
The Rx DSIS switching can also be used to internally connect two ENET SERDES ports when IPTS is used as an internal test source. Two independent paths can be set up initially as follows:

li.p: Serdes port #0 <-> DSIS <-> ENET port #0 <-> ENET MAC <-> ILKN_PKT (IPTS)
Serdes port #1 <-> DSIS <-> ENET port #1 <-> MAPOTN <-> COREOTN <-> OTN port #2

body.p: Each SERDES port can be put into loopback mode then the ENET channel on ENET port #0 can be switched to connect to the ENET port #1. The ENET channel on ENET port #1 then can be remap to ENET port #0. This will create a full data path to ring out the device from ILKN <-> ENET <-> MAPOTN <-> COREOTN <-> LINEOTN.
